subject: Re: [junit] Report "to implement" tests.
msgSnippet: My current feeling is that the best thing to do is to somehow allow custom categories of test results.  I m very reluctant to increase the number of built-in
messageBody:
My current feeling is that the best thing to do is to somehow allow
custom categories of test results. I'm very reluctant to increase the
number of built-in result categories, since such a change is one of
the most likely to break, or at least be under-implemented, in IDEs
and build frameworks.

I'm open to ideas about the best way to do this.

David

On Thu, Apr 14, 2011 at 3:26 PM, lars.vonk <lars.vonk@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I would like to see progress in (acceptance) tests not yet implemented. I want these reported differently than normal failures. Is there a way in JUnit to distinct between expected failing tests and "normal" failing tests?
>
> So in a report I would like to see something like:
>
> Tests: 42
> Failures:0
> Errors: 0
> Ignored: 0
> To implement: 12
>
> Regards, Lars
>
>
>
